front.title: Usability Testing Report
front.author: Walter Scott, Lilia Medvedyeva, Yulin Peng

body.p: This report provides the description of the product and objectives of the usability test and explains the methods applyed in the usability test.
It analyzes the test results, and gives the conclusion drawn from the analysis.
The report also lists the necessary modifications and all "fix" works fullfiled by the manual writing team.
At the end of the report, there is an appendix including task list, post-test questionnaire, orientation script, and profile of test participants for reference.

li.p: The Bookshelf Editor 1.1 is a compact application designed to help you to stor, orgnize and manage links to online content.
The purpose of the test is to test the Bookshelf Editor User's Manual.
The objectives of the test are to verify the following:

ol.li: The information presented in the Bookshelf Editor manual is complete and accurate.
The manial is helpful to end users in accomplishing the basic tasks.
The answers to the specific questions are easy to find.
The language used in the manual is clear and concise.
The manual instructions contain sufficient amount of detail to successfully complete a specific task.
The refereance information for commands, controls, options is clear and complete.

body.p: The test was conducted with each participant in the isolated environment. The test equipment was Windows 7 machine with the Bookshelf Editor application already installed.
All participants of the test were

ul.li: familiar with how to use a computer, perform basic Windows functions, and browse the internet
new to the Bookshelf Editor software

body.p: A person who conducts the teat (a tester)

ul.li: reads the Orientation Script to a participant
gives a hard copy of the test tasks
observes the teat session and takes notes
conducts post-testing interview with the participants

body.p: Four(?) participants have tested the Bookshelf Editor User's Manual. Referencing the user's manual, participants fullfililed the tasks listed on the task list.
Most of the scores on the evaluate score are 1, or 2 of 6.
Participants thought that the User's Manual was very easy to use. They could find the information easily and get clear instruction for their oprations.
The results of the interview based on the questions on the post-test questionnaire are also satisfied.
In some places, participants point out some inconsistent about the manual such as select ... ... etc.
We will add more based on our test results.
Overall the User's manual is clear, concise, accurate, and easy to use. It is a success product.

body.p: Hi [the participant's name]
Thank you for agreeing to participate in testing.
I'm [the tester's name]. I will be working with you today, monitoring this session, and making some notes.

The purpose of this test is to determine how useful the Bookshelf Editor manual for accomplishing some typical tasks in the Bookshelf Editor application. Please do not be concerned with achieving results. We are not testing you. You are here to help us to detect hidden problems with the manual.

Before the beginning of the test, I will give you a sheet with a list of tasks to complete in Bookshelf Editor. During the session, you will work through each task, and I will be making some notes. Please note that you’re testing not the software, but the manual. I ask you please refer to the Bookshelf Editor manual for the information on how to complete each task. I also ask you to consult with the manual first if you have any questions related to the software functionality or user interface.
You can ask any question any time, but I may not answer them since we will be testing the usability of the documentation.
I would like to encourage you to think out loud as you will be working through a specific task.
After you complete each task, I’ll ask you to rate how useful the manual was for helping you to perform the task. I will use a 6-point evaluation scale for each task in a list.
After you finish the test, I’m going to ask you a few questions regarding your experience using the manual.
Any moment during the test, you are free to leave if you want.
Do you have any question before we start?
Hello, (the participants’ name),
I’m (the tester’s name).
Thank you for participating in this manual testing.
The purpose of this test is to uncover the usability problems with the user’s manual of the Bookshelf Editor 1.1.
Please notice that you are testing the user’s manual of the bookshelf Editor, not the software itself. You yourself are not being tested.

You will receive a task list with about 20 tasks to be completed. You need to reference the user’s manual to fulfill these tasks, so that you are able to find out how easy, or how difficult, it is to use the user’s manual. You will help us uncover any problems with the user’s manual.
After you finish each task, please circle a number on the evaluation scale under each task. You can also put your comments about how helpful the user's manual is along the notes section.
You may ask questions when you encounter any difficulty while you are testing. I might not be allowed to describe how to complete a task, but I might be able to give you some hints.
After you finish all tasks, I'm going to ask you a few questions regarding your experiences using the manual.
Please be aware that you are allowed to leave any time you want.
Please feel free to ask me if you have any further questions.
Thank you very much.
